I don't know how to describe this game other than a masterpiece. The replay value on this is actually exquisite. Not to mention the story... OH MY GOD THE STORY! After playing this game i immediately went to portal 2 then all the mods then read all the lore. I can not get enough of the lore. The amount of effort Valve put into this game is still amazing to this day. Especially in today's climate where all big game developers do is put out the same garbage. 10/10. I would give it more but that's not how ratings work.

A first person puzzle game. Conduct the tests the AI in the mysterious facility presents to you.

The game's puzzles make heavy use of pairs of linked portals. The way these portals are simulated allows them to have interesting interactions with your character and the objects in the world, and they're just generally really cool. The game makes great use of this mechanic and offers a nice assortment of increasingly difficult puzzles that are sure to test your mental prowess. The previously mentioned AI also serves as something of an instructor and narrator, and effectively acts as the source of the game's wonderful, dark sense of humour. It also has nice music!

It's great overall, strongly recommended to fans of puzzles and certain brands of humour.
d

This is an intriguing, humorous, and sometimes dark game with amazing writing and an engaging story. The main story is fairly short but is high-quality, with well-scripted dialogue and some of the best light puzzle gameplay in any game. Simple, short, and sweet, this game is easy to recommend.

[h1] Portal [/h1]

This is a puzzle game that requires the use of portals to solve a variety of escape rooms in a fictitious research facility; If you are yet to be aware of this, please invest in a pair of glasses and look at the pretty pictures above. 

The game does such a good job at introducing its tools to the player that it would be foolish to try to explain them here. If I had to say something useful, I would say that Portal does a lot with a little and I find it hard not to recommend.

The main game is short and is worthy of further playthroughs as it is satisfying to fly through levels that used to stump you; and not because the security camera or radio achievements are worth attaining, they require minor problem solving and failed to interest me anywhere near that of the bonus maps.

The bonus maps are split into two categories, advanced maps, and challenge maps. The advanced maps consist of existing level layouts that have been modified to make the chambers more difficult (if you enjoyed the main game then you will probably enjoy these, I certainly did). The maps are fun and may take you a while to figure out without feeling too disorientating, frustrating, or irritating.

Speaking of irritating, let’s move on to the challenge maps. The challenge maps feature unaltered chambers from the main game but are made  [i] challenging [/i] with the addition of a selectable objective on top of the chamber’s traditional completion. Some of these objectives are enjoyable, some are not. I liked the challenge of trying to complete each chamber in the fewest number of portals, but I did not like trying to complete each chamber in the fewest number of steps, as such, I never completed this section of the game.

That’s about it, I’m afraid. I like this game; I just don’t have an awful lot to talk about. It’s charming, very well made, and Ellen McLain does an incredible job at voice acting. I might play the sequel. 

I hope this was helpful.
[b] James [/b]

Honestly, this game was and still is amazing. The concept of Portal is you shoot portals to get to places, but that's just the basics, there are turrets that can kill you, goo, buttons, and blocks. The game is so fun and I loved the Momentum based puzzles. But the game is very short, it took me 3-4 hours to beat the game, Portal 2 is another game in the portal series, which is longer, has more story, better graphics, etc. Honestly I love this game and you should play it too.

Super fun puzzle game! The concept is simple: your gun shoots 2 colored portals, and when you go through one portal, you come out the other. The goal is to go from point A to point B, which seems easy at a glance, but some of the puzzles can be quite challenging. Highly recommend!
ta de pana

This is probably the most fun puzzle game i have ever played. The puzzles are challenging but you know are all possible. And the commentary from GLaDOS is hilarious and I could listen too it all over again. This game has the ability to be played over and over again and would still be fun and challenging. I Recommend this game be bought with the Orange Box Valve Games pack coming with portal 2, the Half-Lifes, and others (Sale). I definitely got my moneys worth.
I very much enjoyed this game. It had fun puzzles, neat humor, and an ending. I recommend this to anyone who liked the other games that Valve made.

Gostaria de começar dizendo que, Portal ( 1 e 2 ) foi o primeiro jogo do que comprei na steam, mesmo se passando anos nos quais descobri e me encantei por novos jogos, esse aqui não foi esquecido, ele tem a proposta e idéias básicas, mas com os puzzles e os desafios adicionais que o jogo oferece é o que torna ele diferente de outros puzzles...o jogo também é rico em diálogos, e ironia não é o que falta do 'vilão' do jogo hsuashua...diria que o único defeito de Portal é que ele não é tão extenso, mas , mesmo assim é um Excelente Jogo. mesmo platinado o jogo e quase 25 horas ( que na minha opinião seria pouco tempo ), compraria o jogo de novo sem hesitar.
Puzzle + Diálogos = 10/10
